details.title: Space Station Information Management
details.abstract: General requirements and concepts for the 1975 space station information management problem are sized parametrically. Because of the need for feasible distribution of data to space and ground users over long-term flight conditions, emphasis has been placed on the preliminary concepts for onboard data processing and autonomous information handling combined with only single-point ground distribution. The requirements for such extensive critical data-distribution capabilities have been established from preliminary estimates.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
